L7p:Comment.stringValue: === If you have the need to customize this policy
=== please contact CA APIM Support so we can improve customization capability
This policy can be found and should be used as 'Encapsulated Assertion'!

L7p:value.stringValue: Get list of devices of the user

L7p:CassandraQuery.L7p:QueryDocument: SELECT magidentifier AS MAG_IDENTIFIER, devicename AS DEVICE_NAME, devicestatus AS DEVICE_STATUS, username AS DEVICE_USER, certdn AS DEVICE_DN, created AS DEVICE_CREATED, updated AS DEVICE_UPDATED, multiuser AS MULTIUSER, access_token AS ACCESS_TOKEN FROM mag_msso_device_username_view WHERE username=${username}

L7p:Detail.stringValue: 'Like' is not supported in cassandra. Given username: '${username}'

L7p:value.stringValue: Get list of devices of the user

L7p:Detail.stringValue: No query could be executed successfully. username='username'

L7p:value.stringValue: For the case that there are no devices
access_token did not exist, this is a template used further down
Get details of each device of the user

L7p:QueryDocument.stringValue: SELECT magidentifier, access_token FROM mag_msso_device_overview WHERE magidentifier=${identifier.current}

L7p:Comment.stringValue: We only want entries with a client_key and access_token not NULL/Empty

L7p:CassandraQuery.L7p:QueryDocument: SELECT magidentifier, client_key FROM mag_msso_device_overview_token WHERE access_token=${token.current}

SELECT magidentifier AS MAG_IDENTIFIER, devicename AS DEVICE_NAME, devicestatus AS DEVICE_STATUS, username AS DEVICE_USER, certdn AS DEVICE_DN, created AS DEVICE_CREATED, updated AS DEVICE_UPDATED, multiuser AS MULTIUSER, access_token AS ACCESS_TOKEN, csr_base64 AS CSR_BASE64, signed_cert_base64 AS SIGNED_CERT_BASE64, grace_expiration AS GRACE_EXPIRATION FROM mag_msso_device_overview WHERE magidentifier=${queryOverviewToken.magidentifier} AND client_key=${queryOverviewToken.client_key}

L7p:Comment.stringValue: Add NULL values for client_name, client_scope, client_status

L7p:value.stringValue: get all the rows that include details per device

L7p:Comment.stringValue: No tokens associated, so we want to return 1 overview entry where access_token is NULL

L7p:CassandraQuery.L7p:QueryDocument: SELECT magidentifier AS MAG_IDENTIFIER, devicename AS DEVICE_NAME, devicestatus AS DEVICE_STATUS, username AS DEVICE_USER, certdn AS DEVICE_DN, created AS DEVICE_CREATED, updated AS DEVICE_UPDATED, multiuser AS MULTIUSER, access_token AS ACCESS_TOKEN, csr_base64 AS CSR_BASE64, signed_cert_base64 AS SIGNED_CERT_BASE64, grace_expiration AS GRACE_EXPIRATION FROM mag_msso_device_overview WHERE magidentifier=${identifier.current}

L7p:Comment.stringValue: Update client_name, client_status, client_scope fields to NULL

L7p:value.stringValue: get all the rows that include details per device
set the content for the response

L7p:Detail.stringValue: No query could be executed successfully. username='${username}'

L7p:ResourceInfo.L7p:Document: <xsl:stylesheet version="1.0" xmlns:L7j-cassandra="http://ns.l7tech.com/2012/08/cassandra-query-result" xmlns:ns="http://ns.l7tech.com/2012/11/otk-tokenstore" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"> <xsl:output cdata-section-elements="ns:access_token ns:device_created ns:device_dn ns:mag_identifier ns:device_name ns:device_status ns:device_updated ns:device_user ns:multiuser ns:client_name ns:client_status ns:client_scope ns:csr_base64 ns:signed_cert_base64 ns:grace_expiration" encoding="UTF-8" indent="yes" method="xml" omit-xml-declaration="no"/> <xsl:template match="L7j-cassandra:cassandraQueryResult"> <xsl:element name="ns:values"> <xsl:for-each select="L7j-cassandra:row"> <xsl:element name="ns:value"> <xsl:attribute name="index"> <xsl:value-of select="position()"/> </xsl:attribute> <xsl:for-each select="L7j-cassandra:col"> <xsl:element name="ns:{@name}"> <xsl:value-of select="text()"/> </xsl:element> </xsl:for-each> </xsl:element> </xsl:for-each> </xsl:element> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>
